Getting Started

Source: vignettes/getting-started.Rmd
getting-started.Rmd

Model parameterisation

Units

https://swmm5.org/2019/01/20/refactoring-the-swmm-5-help-file-projects-in-swmm5

Install KWB package ‘kwb-r/kwb.swmm’ from GitHub

remotes::install_github(“kwb-r/kwb.swmm”, dependencies = TRUE)


## Define paths


```r
# Load the R package
library(kwb.swmm)
#> SWMM executable not found.

### define paths
paths_list <- list(
  cloud_dir = "projects/swmm_workshop/data",
  file_rain = "timeseries_dahlem_5min_60_Jahre.txt",
  file_clim = "timeseries_clim_Dahlem_60_Jahre.txt",
  path_rain = "<cloud_dir>/<file_rain",
  path_clim = "<cloud_dir>/<file_clim",
  model_dir =  "C:/kwb/projects/swmm_workshop",
  model_name = "Testgebiet_LID_andi",
  model_inp = "<model_dir>/<model_name>.inp",
  model_out = "<model_dir>/<model_name>.out",
  model_rpt = "<model_dir>/<model_name>.rpt",
  swmm_dir = "C:/_UserProg/EPA SWMM 5.1.015",
  swmm_exe = "<swmm_dir>/swmm5.exe"
)

paths <- kwb.utils::resolve(paths_list)

paths
#> $cloud_dir
#> [1] "projects/swmm_workshop/data"
#> 
#> $file_rain
#> [1] "timeseries_dahlem_5min_60_Jahre.txt"
#> 
#> $file_clim
#> [1] "timeseries_clim_Dahlem_60_Jahre.txt"
#> 
#> $path_rain
#> [1] "projects/swmm_workshop/data/<file_rain"
#> 
#> $path_clim
#> [1] "projects/swmm_workshop/data/<file_clim"
#> 
#> $model_dir
#> [1] "C:/kwb/projects/swmm_workshop"
#> 
#> $model_name
#> [1] "Testgebiet_LID_andi"
#> 
#> $model_inp
#> [1] "C:/kwb/projects/swmm_workshop/Testgebiet_LID_andi.inp"
#> 
#> $model_out
#> [1] "C:/kwb/projects/swmm_workshop/Testgebiet_LID_andi.out"
#> 
#> $model_rpt
#> [1] "C:/kwb/projects/swmm_workshop/Testgebiet_LID_andi.rpt"
#> 
#> $swmm_dir
#> [1] "C:/_UserProg/EPA SWMM 5.1.015"
#> 
#> $swmm_exe
#> [1] "C:/_UserProg/EPA SWMM 5.1.015/swmm5.exe"

SWMM Files

This tutorial needs a few climate files which can be provided locally from a predefined folder on your Windows computer or directly downloaded from the KWB Cloud. Within this tutorial the latter approach is used.

Currently one climate input file (rain) and a SWMM .inp file are required:

  • <model_name>.inp (input: SWMM model, prepared using SWMM-GUI, here: )

  • <rain-data>.txt (input: rain data)

Locally

Copy the content of the KWB cloud folder projects/swmm_workshop/data to paths$model_dir (here: C:/kwb/projects/swmm_workshop).

Cloud

You can download the required model files from the KWB cloud if you are a registered user with access to the folder projects/swmm_workshop/data

For doing so follow the steps below:

  1. Open RStudio and run usethis::edit_r_environ()

  2. In the opened window add the required environment variables

NEXTCLOUD_URL = "https://<replace-with-dwc-cloud-url>"
NEXTCLOUD_USER = "<your-dwc-cloud-username>" # your username
NEXTCLOUD_PASSWORD = "your-nextcloud-app-password" ### see details below

For creating <your-nextcloud-app-password>:

  • go to: https://replace-with-dwc-cloud-url/index.php/settings/user/security

  • scroll down to create new app password

  • select a name e.g. r-script and copy the token and replace your-nextcloud-app-password

  1. Finally you need to restart Rstudio and proceed with the code below:



# Download rain data
swmm_climate_files <- kwb.nextcloud::list_files(
  paths$cloud_dir,
  full_info = TRUE) %>% 
  dplyr::filter(file == paths$file_rain)

kwb.nextcloud::download_files(href = swmm_climate_files$href,
                              target_dir = paths$model_dir)

Run SWMM

# run andi`s model 
swmmr::run_swmm(inp = paths$model_inp,
                rpt = paths$model_rpt,
                out = paths$model_out,
                exec = paths$swmm_exe)
                
inp <- swmmr::read_inp(paths$model_inp)

str(inp$lid_usage)


<!-- new_par <- inp$lid_usage %>% -->

<!-- dplyr::mutate(Subcatchment = "Hof2") -->
